title: #Goldilocks: A Hashtag Cautionary Tale
author: Jeanne Willis
description: At first, everyone loves Goldilocks’s hilarious online posts, but in her desperation to get more likes, she crosses the line and leaves her reputation in tatters. Illustrated by Tony Ross

title: The 39 Steps
author: Andrew Lane
description: Richard Hannay is on the run! The police think he is a murderer, and a secret organisation think he can stop their plot to start a war. All Richard has is a black notebook full of codes - can he work out what they mean before it's too late?

title: The Abominables
author: Eva Ibbotson
description: Snatched by a hairy monster in the night, a young explorer discovers that her kidnapper is a brave and noble beast whose family is in danger. Illustrated by Sharon Rentta

title: The Accidental Prime Minister
author: Tom McLaughlin
description: Joe only wanted to save his mum's job, but ended up becoming Prime Minister. Not everyone, however, is pleased for him and things start to go wrong for Joe.

title: Ada Lovelace
author: Isabel Sánchez Vegara
description: This is the story of Ada Lovelace, whose work with the famous inventor, Charles Babbage, made her the world's first computer programmer.

title: Adam Goes Shopping
author: Roderick Hunt
description: Adam doesn't like shopping but has to go with his family anyway. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 4 Sparrows.

title: Adam's Car
author: Roderick Hunt
description: Adam plays with his new car. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 4 Sparrows.

title: Ade Adepitan: A Paralympian's Story
author: Ade Adepitan
description: Ade Adepitan's biography to date. Sapphire Band 16.

title: Adrenalin Rush
author: Alex Lane
description: This book looks at some of the world's most dangerous and exciting sports. Project X Origins. Level 17. Book band 15 (Red).

title: An Adventure for Robo-Dog
author: Pat Thomson
description: Robo-dog and the other toys in the toy box have a late night adventure. Oxford Reading Tree All Stars. Book Band 9 (Gold).

title: The Adventure Park
author: Roderick Hunt
description: The family has an exciting day out. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 5.

title: The Adventures of Egg Box Dragon
author: Richard Adams
description: Emma is delighted when her home-made dragon magically comes to life! He is excellent at finding Lost Treasures so when the Queen loses a diamond from her crown, there's only one dragon to call!

title: The Adventures of King Arthur
author: Russell Punter
description: With the Kingdom of Britain facing chaos, Merlin takes the infant Prince Arthur into hiding. Many years later, Arthur discovers that he is the country's rightful ruler. The newly crowned King Arthur must fight many battles to keep his kingdom intact.

title: The Adventures of Robin Hood
author: Marcia Williams
description: An exuberant comic-strip retelling of eleven of Robin Hood's adventures: from becoming an outlaw and meeting Little John and Friar Tuck to falling in love with Maid Marian and battling with Guy of Gisborne.

title: The Adventures of the Dish and the Spoon
author: Mini Grey
description: Having run away together, the Dish and the Spoon from the nursery rhyme The Cat and the Fiddle become stars in a travelling show before turning to a life of crime.

title: The Adventures of the New Cut Gang
author: Philip Pullman
description: The gang investigates the appearance of fake coins, which are turning up all over Lambeth; and the gang must solve the mystery of stolen silver cups and trophies.

title: Africa's Big Three
author: Jonathan Scott
description: Learn all about the three largest animals on Earth. The co-author is Angela Scott. Turquoise band 7

title: The African Grasslands
author: Alan Trussell-Cullen
description: Learn about the African grasslands' food chain, from plants to predators. Level 17, Turquoise.

title: After the Storm
author: Nick Butterworth
description: A storm is raging and Percy, the park keeper, is having a sleepless night. When he gets up the following morning, Percy finds that the old oak tree has been blown down. It is a disaster for his animal friends that live there, but Percy has a solution.

title: Agent Spike and the Vegetables of Doom
author: Mark Burgess
description: When a science experiment goes terribly wrong, a group of mutant veggies threaten to take over the world. Luckily Agent Spike of the Secret Service is on the case, and with the help from a few tomatoes, Spike tries to stop this produce posse. Ages 7-9.

title: Agent Weasel and the Fiendish Fox Gang
author: Nick East
description: Agent Weasel is on the trail of the Fiendish Fox Gang who are planning to ruin an important event in The United Woodlands. Book #1

title: Agent Zaiba Investigates: The Haunted House
author: Annabelle Sami
description: Zaiba investigates strange goings-on at the home of her new friend Olivia. Is Olivia's house haunted or does someone human have a motive to cause trouble for her family? Book #3

title: Agent Zaiba Investigates: The Poison Plot
author: Annabelle Sami
description: Agent Zaiba finds her second big case when a poisoner strikes at her school fete. Can she and her fellow detectives follow the clues and find the culprit? Book #2

title: Air Scare
author: Jan Burchett
description: Tiger enters his model plane, The Whizzer, in a flying contest. Little does he know that Lucy plans to knock him off course with her plane. Project X Origins. Level 11. Book Band 12 (Brown).

title: Aircraft
author: Alison Hawes
description: This book has lots of facts about aircraft in the past and aircraft today. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 5. Floppy's Phonics. Book Band 5 Green.

title: Ajay and the Jaipur Moon
author: Varsha Shah
description: Ajay and his friends' newspaper needs a big story. So when Ajay sees a cash prize for a competition to be the first to find a meteorite that has crashed to Earth, their very own space-race to Jaipur is on. Book #2

title: Aladdin
author: Joanna Nadin
description: Aladdin's adventures are just beginning when a sorcerer promises to make him rich, if he helps him find a magic lamp. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 7. Floppy's Phonics Book Band 7 (Turquoise).

title: Albert's Raccoon
author: Karen Wallace
description: A trip to the sweet factory is full of surprises for Albert and his new pet Rocky the raccoon.

title: Alex Neptune: Dragon Thief
author: David Owen
description: For as long as Alex Neptune can remember, the ocean has been trying to kill him. He's not too happy when he discovers an imprisoned water dragon needs his help. Text has an incidence of violence and reference to animal cruelty. Book #1

title: Alexander Graham Bell
author: Catherine Chambers
description: This book traces the life of Alexander Graham Bell, from his early childhood and education through his sources of inspiration and challenges faced, early successes, and the invention for which he is best known: the telephone.

title: Alf Saves the Day
author: Mal Peet
description: Alf loves soccer, but is he any good at playing it? Oxford Reading Tree Stage 5. Snapdragons.

title: Ali's Story
author: Jan Wells
description: Two short stories about Ali and a monkey and Ali fishing with his dad.

title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland/Alice in Wonderland
author: Lewis Carroll
description: Alice lives an ordinary life, until the day she finds herself in the wonderful world of mad tea parties and remarkable characters. This text is also published under the title Alice in Wonderland.

title: Aliens in Underpants Save the World
author: Claire Freedman
description: Aliens in underpants are back, and this time they are on a mission to save the world.

title: Aliens Love Dinopants
author: Claire Freedman
description: When a group of aliens crash-lands in the jungle, they stumble upon the biggest stash of underpants ever. But the over-sized owners of the underwear treasure aren't going to back down without a fight.

title: Alistair Grim's Odd Aquaticum
author: Gregory Funaro
description: In order to defeat Prince Nightshade, Grim is determined to find the elusive Excalibur, King Arthur's sword, which contains very powerful magic, in Avalon. The plot contains violence. Book #2

title: All About Hair
author: Claire Llewellyn
description: This book shows all the things we can use to look after our hair and what people used in the past.

title: All About Robin Hood
author: Claire Llewellyn
description: Was Robin Hood a real person, or was he just a legend? Oxford Reading Tree Stage 6. Floppy's Phonics Book Band 6 (Orange).

title: All Because of Jackson
author: Dick King-Smith
description: Jackson and his friend Bunny stow away on the Atalanta and sail off in search of a new life.

title: All for One
author: Jill Murphy
description: Marlon tries very hard to be part of the neighbourhood games until he finds something else to do that makes everyone want to join him.

title: All in One Piece
author: Jill Murphy
description: Mr and Mrs Large are getting ready for the office dinner-dance. But with Lester, Laura, Luke and the baby around, they'll be lucky to get out of the house all in one piece.

title: Alone on a Wide Wide Sea
author: Michael Morpurgo
description: Orphaned in WWII, a young boy is separated from his sister and sent to Australia. There he survives a brutal existence on a farm, finds a new family, and becomes a boat builder.

title: Always Elephant
author: Geraldine McCaughrean
description: Mole helps a tired bird, and in return she helps him become king of the animals.

title: The Amazing Adventures of Batbird
author: Jane Clarke
description: Dunkan learns he does not have to pretend to be Batbird in order to save the day. Illustrated by Nick Schon. Lime Band 11

title: Amazing Aeroplanes
author: Tony Mitton
description: Jet above the clouds with a loopy animal crew to learn about aeroplanes.

title: Amazing Animals of the Desert
author: Danny Pearson
description: The desert may look deserted, but it's certainly not! It's full of strange and amazing animals. Do you know which animal can close its nostrils in a sandstorm? Or which desert creature never drinks water? Find the answers in this book.

title: An Amazing Find
author: Tony Bradman
description: When on a trip in the woods, the children and Nok find something amongst the leaves. Book Band 6 Orange A. Oxford Level 6.

title: Amazing Grace
author: Mary Hoffman
description: Although a classmate says that she cannot play Peter Pan in the school play because she is black, Grace discovers that she can do anything she sets her mind to do.

title: The Amazing Life of Azaleah Lane
author: Nikki Shannon Smith
description: Azaleah can't wait for her class field trip to the National Zoo in Washington DC, especially when her teacher announces the chance to earn extra science points. But when Azaleah gets home, she quickly realises it isn't as easy as she thought. Book #1

title: Amazing Muslims Who Changed the World
author: Burhana Islam
description: Meet just some of the amazing Muslim men and women who have changed the world, from pirate queens and athletes to warriors and scientists. Contains violence, and themes of prejudice.

title: The Amazing Story of Adolphus Tips
author: Michael Morpurgo
description: When Boowie reads the diary that his grandmother sends him, he learns of her childhood during WW II, when Allied forces practised for the D-Day invasion in the area of her home, and about her beloved cat, Adolphus Tips.

title: Amazing Whales
author: Jillian Powell
description: This book looks at the biggest, heaviest and loudest animals in the ocean -- the whales

title: The Amber Spyglass
author: Philip Pullman
description: Lyra and Will find themselves at the centre of a battle between the forces of the Authority and those gathered by Lyra's father, Lord Asriel. Third in the His Dark Materials trilogy.

title: Amber's Big Dog
author: Margaret Ryan
description: Amber loves her dog. But looking after him is hard work!

title: Amictus the Bug Queen
author: Adam Blade
description: Tom's quest to free the Mistress of the Beasts brings him to a sweltering jungle. There he must defeat cunning Amictus and her deadly young.

title: Anastasia Again!
author: Lois Lowry
description: Anastasia can't see how her parents can even think of moving to the suburbs and enlists her two-year-old brother to prevent the move.

title: Ancient Egypt
author: George Hart
description: The world of the pharaohs in words and pictures.

title: Ancient Greeks
author: Stephanie Turnbull
description: In this book you will find out about how the Ancient Greeks' Olympic Games differed from ours today, and also about their warriors, gods and way of life.

title: Andrew Watson
author: Adam Sutherland
description: The story of the UKs first black footballer in 1880. Illustrated by David Young. Purple Band 8 / Sapphire Band 16

title: The Angel of Nitshill Road
author: Anne Fine
description: Until the angel came, there were three terribly unhappy children at Nitshill Road School: Penny, Mark and Marigold. They had Barry Hunter to worry about, everyone knew what a bully he was, but no one did anything about it until the angel came.

title: Angelina on Stage
author: Katharine Holabird
description: Angelina and Henry have parts in a ballet. During rehearsals, Angelina's excitement turns to jealousy when Henry becomes the favourite of the famous Madame Zizi. But after near disaster on opening night, Angelina and Henry become better friends than ever

title: Angelina, Star of the Show
author: Katharine Holabird
description: Angelina, headed to the Mouseland Dance Festival aboard her grandparents' canal boat, is so obsessed with practising her dance moves and so neglectful of her duties that the trip turns into a near disaster.

title: Anglerfish: The Seadevil of the Deep
author: Elaine M. Alexander
description: Dive thirteen-thousand feet beneath the ocean's surface into the midnight zone, home to the anglerfish. Learn all about this cunning hunter known as the sea-devil of the deep.

title: Animal Communication
author: Phil Gates
description: Describes how animals communicate with us and others in the wild.

title: Animal Conflicts
author: Steve Parker
description: Find out why animals get into conflicts, what they do to protect themselves and how they fight back. Project X Origins. Level 11. Book Band 12 (Brown).

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: Politically-minded farm animals spark a revolution against their human master and establish a new government that fails because of a corrupt leader tempted by greed and power.

title: Animal Feet
author: Greg Pyers
description: This book explains how animals use their feet.

title: Animal Giants
author: Barbara Taylor
description: This book provides information on the largest and most powerful creatures of land, air and sea. Part of the Kingfisher Knowledge series.

title: Animal Homes
author: Diane James
description: This book introduces young children to the world of animals and their homes.

title: Animal Homes
author: Anita Ganeri
description: From a snug mouse nest to a huge bat cave, this book explores the amazing world of animal homes and habitats.

title: The Animal Hospital
author: John Talbot
description: When Mr Keeping goes to Hong Kong where can he leave Bruce, his pet monkey?

title: The Animal Olympics
author: Joy Cowley
description: This book includes two stories: "The Animal Olympics" and "The Accident".

title: AniMalcolm
author: David Baddiel
description: Malcolm isn't an animal fan, yet all his family love them. A school trip to a farm changes everything, and Malcolm learns more about animals than he bargained for. A whole series of animals.

title: Animals on the Move
author: Deborah Chancellor
description: Find out how various kinds of animals migrate, and why. Copper Band 12

title: Anisha Accidental Detective: Holiday Adventure!
author: Serena Patel
description: The holiday park's mascot, Delilah the duck, has been destroyed, and Anisha's friend Cleo is everyone's number one suspect. But Anisha believes Cleo is innocent, and is going to do whatever it takes to prove it. Book #5

title: Anna Hibiscus' Song
author: Atinuke
description: Anna Hibiscus is so happy, she doesn't know what to do. The members of her family share their ideas, but Anna eventually comes up with the very best idea of all.

title: Anne Boleyn and Me: A Tudor Girl's Diary, 1525-1536
author: Alison Prince
description: Elinor, a lady-in-waiting, tells the story of the royal court and King Henry's relationship with Anne Boleyn.

title: Anne Fine
author: Chris Powling
description: A brief biography of English novelist Anne Fine.

title: Anneli the Art Hater
author: Anne Fine
description: Anneli hated art even before a painting almost frightened her out of her wits, but then she finds that art can tell the most extraordinary story.

title: Annie the Gorilla Nanny
author: Jeanne Willis
description: Meet Annie, nanny to the young of the monkey world. She's worked for Tarzan and Jane and been nursemaid to an orang-utan and babysat for twin baboons. But now Annie has to teach manners to a young gorilla.

title: Another Twist in the Tale
author: Catherine Bruton
description: Discover the exciting tale of Twill, sister of Oliver Twist, as she fights villains alongside the Artful Dodger in London. Plot contains gender bias, violence, animal cruelty, disturbing imagery and offensive language.

title: Ant and the Break-bot
author: Chris Powling
description: The new Robo-Rex film is coming to town. Ant and his friends have a chance to win free tickets ... if they can build an amazing robot of their own. Project X Origins. Level 10. Book band 10 (White).

title: Ant Meets the Queen
author: Jan Burchett
description: Ant's curiosity gets him into trouble when he gets too close to an ants' nest and he is carried away to meet the queen. Project X Origins. Level 11. Book Band 11 (Lime).

title: Ant Storm
author: Anthony McGowan
description: It's bad enough when Max, Cat, Ant and Tiger get evicted from their micro-den by an army of ants. But it's nothing compared to what they find in the ants' nest. Could Dr X be involved? Project X Origins. Level 11. Book Band 12 (Brown).

title: Ant's Pact
author: Elen Caldecott
description: Livi takes the friends to her underwater village, Akwa, and they make a deal with Breni.Book Band 8 Purple. Oxford Level 8.

title: Antarctica: Land of the Penguins
author: Jonathan Scott
description: The survival of the white continent's most famous inhabitants, the beauty of Antarctic and the enchanting secrets of its penguin population is brought to life in this book. Coauthor is Angela Scott. White Band 10

title: Antony and Cleopatra
author: Andrew Matthews
description: This book provides a junior reader's introduction to Shakespeare’s story of love and death.

title: Ants at Home
author: Haydn Middleton
description: Max and Cat go underground to find out more about the world of ants. Project X Origins. Level 11. Book Band 11 (Lime).

title: Anya's Camera
author: Jackie Tidey
description: Anya's gran gives her a camera, and Anya tries to photograph her cat.

title: Anyone Can Have a Pet
author: Nicki Atkinson
description: Brad wishes he had a pet to talk about to the class. Then he has an idea about the bluejay he has been drawing.

title: Ape's Great Escape
author: Russell Punter
description: Ape makes a great escape from prison. But will he be able to outrun the prison guards?Co-author is David Semple.

title: Aquila
author: Andrew Norriss
description: Two boys find something that has been buried for seventeen hundred years. They have no idea where it came from or what it does, but they discover that when you sit in it, little coloured lights come on, and if you push one of the big blue ones... whoosh!

title: Arabian Nights
author: Martin Waddell
description: Two favourite tales from Arabian Nights are retold, involving an evil magician, a magic lamp and a young girl who longs to marry a prince. Oxford Reading Tree All Stars.

title: Arachnid the King of Spiders
author: Adam Blade
description: Tom and his companions must go to the caves of Avantia where the massive and terrifying Arachnid the King of Spiders lives. Arachnid preys on the local townspepole and guards a piece of the magical golden armour. Book #11

title: Archie the Big Good Wolf (Big Cat)
author: Allan Baillie
description: In this play, Archie Wolf tells how he is drawn into the country's worst crime wave.

title: Arctic Hero
author: Catherine Johnson
description: This book tells the true story of Matthew Henson, a black man who reached the North Pole before anyone else, but who was treated like a second-class citizen at home in America.

title: Around the World in Eighty Days
author: Jules Verne
description: Phileas Fogg and his servant make a breathless world tour, overcoming wild misadventures and rescuing a beautiful Indian maharani.

title: Arsenic for Tea
author: Robin Stevens
description: Over the school holiday, Daisy's mother throws a tea party for her birthday. One of the guests falls seriously, mysteriously, fatally ill. It looks like poison. Daisy and her chum Hazel investigate. Book #2

title: Arthur and the Golden Rope
author: Joe Todd-Stanton
description: A young boy named Arthur saves his town with the help of Thor, the god of storms. Book #1

title: Arthur and the Yeti
author: Johanne Mercier
description: When Arthur's neighbour hears strange noises coming from her garden, Cousin Eugene is called to investigate. Before long Picket Lake is full of people trying to look for a yeti.

title: Arthur High King of Britain
author: Michael Morpurgo
description: The legend of King Arthur and the knights of the Round Table has fired the imagination of young and old for centuries. It is the ultimate tale of chivalry and romance, of evil, magic and betrayal.

title: Arthur King and the Curious Case of the Time Train
author: Dean Wilkinson
description: Arthur King fancies himself as a bit of a sleuth and sets out to solve the case of the mysterious appearance of marauding Neanderthals in the boys' toilets at Bassleton School.

title: Arthur's Fantastic Party
author: Joseph Theobald
description: Arthur wants to throw a party for all the best, most fantastic animals. Orange band 6

title: As Quiet as a Mouse
author: Karen Owen
description: Edgar keeps waking up his new baby sister, but he can't help being noisy. Luckily his friend Ruby has an idea! Can Edgar learn to be as quiet as a mouse?

title: At the Pool
author: Roderick Hunt
description: Kipper goes to the pool but he has forgotten his swimming trunks. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 3 More Stories B.

title: Atlantic Adventure
author: Michael Perham
description: Cat and Tiger join Michael Perham on his record-breaking sailing adventure. Project X Origins. Level 8. Book band 8 (Purple).

title: Attack of the Blobs
author: Tony Bradman
description: Max, Ant, Tiger and Nok go in search of the king and queen, but will they escape the terrifying blob monsters? Book Band 12 Brown. Oxford Level 11

title: Attack of the Centipede
author: Jan Burchett
description: Tiger shrinks to micro-size to explore a wormery. But a giant centipede is on the loose. Will Tiger escape? Co-author is Sara Vogler. Project X Origins. Level 8. Book band 8 (Purple). Theme: Habitat.

title: Attack of the Demon Dinner Ladies
author: Pamela Butchart
description: School dinners have changed at Izzy's school and it's not long before she and her friends suspect the dinner ladies of being demons.

title: Attack of the Giant Meeb
author: Steve Cole
description: When Ant, Tiger and Seven go underground to escape the krools they encounter a giant meeb. How will they escape?

title: Attack of the Tentacled Terror
author: Susan Gates
description: When George stays with Aunt Primrose during the holidays, certain doubts start to creep into his mind. Has she really got tentacles? And what exactly is she keeping in the cellar? There's no way George is going to guess the truth.

title: Attack of the X-bots!
author: Anthony McGowan
description: Dr X has unleashed his X-bot army. Max, Cat, Tiger and Ant have built up the defences around their new micro-den. Now they wait anxiously for the attack... Project X Origins. Level 11. Book Band 12 (Brown).

title: Augustus and His Smile
author: Catherine Rayner
description: After searching mountains, forests, oceans, and deserts to find his smile, Augustus the tiger finds it when he looks in a puddle, and realises that "happiness is everywhere around him."

title: The Austere Academy
author: Lemony Snicket
description: As their outrageous misfortune continues, the Baudelaire orphans are shipped off to a miserable boarding school, and find that they have been followed by the dreaded Count Olaf. Text contains child abuse and slightly sexual themes. Book #5

title: The Awesome Egyptians
author: Terry Deary
description: This book gives some awful information about Egyptians who lived an awesome 5,000 years ago. It contains foul facts about death and decay and recipes for 3,000-year-old sweets. The co-author is Peter Hepplewhite.

title: Awful Auntie
author: David Walliams
description: Stella Saxby is the sole heir to Saxby Hall. But awful Aunt Alberta and her giant owl will stop at nothing to get it from her. Luckily Stella has a secret - and slightly spooky - weapon up her sleeve...

title: The Awful Egyptians
author: Terry Deary
description: Following on from his Horrible History of the Awesome Egyptians, Terry Deary reveals more disgusting details about the awesome ancients, their groovy gods, potty pyramids and of course, their mad mummies. Book has violence.

title: Awful End
author: Philip Ardagh
description: Both of Eddie's parents catch a disease that makes them turn yellow and smell of old hot-water bottles and it's agreed he should go and stay with relatives. Unfortunately, those relatives are Mad Uncle Jack and Aunt Maud. First in a trilogy.

title: Aztec, Inca, and Maya
author: Robert Snedden
description: This book covers the inventions and technology of the Aztecs, Incas and Maya and how these ideas influenced technology today.

title: Baba Yaga
author: Tony Bradman
description: Natasha is sent into the dark forest to visit Baba Yaga. She has a very bad feeling about it... Oxford Reading Tree Stage 7. Traditional Tales Book Band 7 (Turquoise).

title: Baba Yaga the Flying Witch
author: Susanna Davidson
description: When her stepmother tells Tasha to visit a witch named Baba Yaga to get a needle and thread, Tasha soon finds herself in a trap from which she must use her wits and cunning to escape.

title: Baby Aliens Got My Teacher!
author: Pamela Butchart
description: Izzy and friends are surprised when their teacher, Miss Jones, starts being nice. Soon, they begin to suspect that she has been taken over by aliens.

title: Baby Elephant
author: Susan Hellard
description: Ephra never pays attention to anything her family tells her. But one day at the lake, Ephra has a nasty shock and learns what can happen when you don't listen.

title: The Baby Who Wouldn't Go to Bed
author: Helen Cooper
description: The Baby wants to stay up all night, so he revs up his car and sets off on an adventure. Before long, he finds himself all alone in a sleepy land, but there is someone else who's not asleep; someone who loves the Baby very much.

title: Back-to-Front Benjy
author: Dick King-Smith
description: Benjy does everything back to front and causes chaos at school, Bartholomew is very rude, Brown is a most unpleasant young wizard and Little Lionel tells lies! What happens to change them all is very funny and quite unexpected!

title: Backstage at the School Play
author: Alison Reynolds
description: What happens when a thunderstorm knocks out the electricity for the school play? The show must go on!

title: Bad Cats
author: Pat Thomson
description: When the Badcat Gang of stray cats plan a coup at the barbeque next door, it is little Hattie the hamster that ends up saving the day. Oxford Reading Tree All Stars.

title: Bad Dad
author: David Walliams
description: Frank's dad was a champion banger racer. But when a terrible accident sees him go from hero to zero, Frank and Gilbert are left with nothing - and in the grips of a crime boss. And, when Gilbert is thrown in prison, only Frank can come to his rescue.

title: Bad Dog Bonnie
author: Bel Mooney
description: After Bonnie shreds the phone bill and attacks the new postman, Mum decides it is time for a visit to the Best-Ever Dog Training School, but Bonnie isn't your average problem pooch, and she has reasons for making mischief. Book #3

title: A Bad Spell for the Worst Witch
author: Jill Murphy
description: Mildred is determined to lose her embarrassing reputation as the worst witch the Academy has ever seen, but things rapidly get out of hand.

title: Bader's Battle
author: Mick Manning
description: After losing his legs in a flying accident, Douglas Bader became a famous pilot. The co-author is Brita Granström. Gold Band 9 / Diamond Band 17

title: Badger's Parting Gifts
author: Susan Varley
description: When old Badger dies, his friends think they will be sad forever. But gradually they are able to remember Badger with joy and to treasure the gifts he left behind for every one of his friends.

title: A Bag of Tricks
author: Alison Hawes
description: Lucy has a bag of tricks. She tricks Max and Cat.Book Band 2 Red B. Oxford Level 2.

title: Baggage
author: Robin Etherington
description: Randall is a happy-go-lucky but disaster-prone lost property officer. In order to save the job he loves, he must locate the owner of the oldest item stored in his immense warehouse -- in just one day!

title: The Ballerina of Doom
author: Anthony McGowan
description: Tiger is trapped in a toyshop. An X-bot is after his special watch. Will Max, Cat and Ant get there in time to save him? Or will they all get crushed by the Ballerina of Doom? Project X Origins. Level 11. Book band 11 (Lime). Theme: Trapped.

title: The Balloon Team
author: Chris Powling
description: Max, Cat, Ant and Tiger decide to build their own hot air balloon. But they soon realise it's not so much fun when they actually take off! Project X Origins. Level 10. Book band 10 (White).

title: Bananas for Breakfast
author: Jane Langford
description: Kofi wants bananas for breakfast, so he takes some from Efia's tree. When Efia finds out, she decides to teach him a lesson.

title: The Band of Friends
author: Michaela Morgan
description: A donkey, a dog, a cat, and a rooster decide to form a band. Oxford Readign Tree Stage 8. Snapdragons. Book Band 8 (Purple).

title: The Barbecue
author: Roderick Hunt
description: Wilf's dad wants to have a barbecue but the rain spoils his plans. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 3.

title: The Barmy British Empire
author: Terry Deary
description: This book gives you the brutal facts about how the British Empire was constructed.

title: Barn Owls
author: Patricia Whitehouse
description: This book describes the physical characteristics, behaviour and habitat of barn owls.

title: Barry Loser and the Case of the Crumpled Carton
author: Jim Smith
description: When Barry is accused of a dastardly deed, he dons his detective hat to discover the real culprit.

title: Barry Loser and the Holiday of Doom
author: Jim Smith
description: Barry thinks taking his two best friends on holiday will be great, but quickly changes his mind.

title: Barry Loser and the Trouble with Pets
author: Jim Smith
description: Barry is pestering is mum for a pet dog so that he doesn't feel such a gooseberry being alone when all his friends start pairing off in couples. Book #11

title: Bats
author: Megan Cullis
description: Easy-reading text introduces the secret lives of bats, including what they look like, where they live, what they eat, and which animals bring danger.

title: Batter Splatter!
author: Ruth Morgan
description: An important visitor comes to school when the children are making pancakes. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 6. Snapdragons.

title: The Battle of Bubble and Squeak
author: Philippa Pearce

title: Best Mates

title: The Blue Bog Baby

description: High/low series for struggling readers aged 7 to 9+ years.Level 5 Tiger Tracks. Reading Age: 6.09Interest Age: 9+

title: Bodies

title: The Boss Dog of Blossom Street

title: Boys United

title: Brad's Birthday Cake
author: Dawn McMillan
description: Ella makes a cake for her neighbour's birthday. Illustrated by Pat Reynolds

title: The Brave Baby

title: Breath

title: Brown Bear and Wilbur Wolf

title: Brown Mouse Gets Some Corn

title: Bug in a Rug

description: Bug glugs hot chocolate from a mug, then snuggles up inside his rug, trying to get sleep for his first day of work. Co-author is David Semple.

title: Bugs for Breakfast

description: With their mother, Dilly and Dally Duck go searching for breakfast.

title: Bugs! Bugs! Bugs!

title: Building High

title: The Butterfly Lion
author: Michael Morpurgo

title: Buzz and Bingo in the Fairytale Forest
author: Alan Durant
description: Buzz and Bingo meet a number of characters in the woods who are all looking for the same beautiful girl. Illustrated by Sholto Walker. Gold Band 9

title: Buzz and Bingo in the Monster Maze
author: Alan Durant
description: Buzz and Bingo must go through a Monster Maze to get to the Monster Party. Illustrated by Sholto Walker. Purple Band 8

title: Buzz and Bingo in the Starry Sky

title: Buzz and Zip Get Lost
author: Carmel Reilly
description: High/low series for 7-14 year olds with a reading age of 5.5 to 9. Level 10 (Blue) -- reading age 5.5 to 6.

title: By the Stream

description: Kipper drops Teddy in the stream. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 3 Stories.

title: Cakes in Space

title: The Call of the Wolf
author: Carmel Reilly
description: High/low series for 7-14 year olds with a reading age of 5.5 to 9. Level 12 (Green) -- reading age 5.5 to 6.

title: The Camcorder
author: Roderick Hunt
description: Wilma makes a video. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 4.

title: The Camel Fair
author: Wendy Cooling
description: Sarina visits the Camel Fair in Pushkar, slashing her day. White Band 10

title: Cameron Battle and the Hidden Kingdoms
author: Jamar J. Perry
description: When Cameron and his friends are transported through the pages of an ancestral book to the West African country of Chidani, they find a kingdom in extreme danger and must find a way to save the Igbo people. Text contains violence and racism.

title: Camping Adventure
author: Roderick Hunt
description: Wilf and Wilma go camping. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 5 More Stories B.

title: Can It Really Rain Frogs?

title: Can You Cuddle Like a Koala?
author: John Butler
description: An introduction to some animal behaviour which young children can copy.

title: Can You Feel the Noise?
author: Stewart Foster
description: When Sophie wakes up completely deaf one morning, the life she once knew seems like a distant memory. Themes include ableism.

title: Can You See Me?
author: Libby Scott
description: Tally is autistic, but she hides it as much as she can. By masking her autism, Tally is hiding her real self. But when your real self is fierce and wonderful, it can't stay hidden forever. Book has offensive language (ableism). Book #1

title: Can't You Sleep, Little Bear?
author: Martin Waddell
description: When bedtime comes, Little Bear is afraid of the dark until Big Bear brings him light and love.

title: Candyfloss
author: Jacqueline Wilson
description: When her mother plans to move to Australia with her new husband and baby, Floss must decide whether her loyalties lie with her mother or her father, while at the same time, her best friend begins to make fun of her and reject her.

title: Captain Abdul's Pirate School
author: Colin McNaughton
description: A small girl causes havoc at the pirate school.

title: Captain Comet and the Dog Star
author: Jonathan Emmett
description: As Spanner the robot, Captain Comet, and Captain Stella are watching a scary film at the Stardust Space Station, the space scanner starts beeping and an adventure begins. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 9 More Stories A.

title: Captain Comet and the Purple Planet
author: Jonathan Emmett
description: When Spanner the robot plants his flag on a new planet, he discovers that the plant is a space monster. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 9. TreeTops.

title: Captain Fantastic
author: Tom Palmer
description: Since Ryan got into trouble for bullying, he's been determined to pull his socks up and be the best captain United's ever had. So when teammate Craig causes problems on the pitch, Ryan knows he must solve them. Book #6

title: Captain Pepper's Pets
author: Sally Grindley
description: The tyrannical Captain Pepper demands that his crew find him an alternative to the traditional pirate's parrot as a pet.

title: Captain Scott: Journey to the South Pole
author: Adrian Bradbury
description: Captain Scott, naval officer and explorer wanted to be the first person to reach the South Pole. Discover what happened to him and his men when they went to the coldest place on Earth. Illustrated by Kate Evans and Bob Moulder. Purple Band 8

title: Captain Underpants and the Attack of the Talking Toilets
author: Dav Pilkey
description: Captain Underpants must intervene when George and Harold accidentally create an army of evil, talking toilets that intend to take over the world.

title: Captain Underpants and the Big, Bad Battle of the Bionic Booger Boy, Part I:The Night of the Nasty Nostril Nuggets
author: Dav Pilkey
description: Another Captain Underpants adventure in which our hero foils an attempt by Melvin Sneedly, the school swot, to create a bionic and rather snotty, super boy.

title: Captain Underpants and the Invasion...Incredibly Naughty Cafeteria Ladies from Outer Space
author: Dav Pilkey
description: Is Captain Underpants ready to take on three massive, tentacled space aliens (in disguise)? And has he met his match in a battle with the Giant Man-Eating Dandelion of Doom?

title: Care of Henry
author: Anne Fine
description: Hugo has to choose who to stay with while his mother's having a baby. Granny? Mrs Mariposa next door? Uncle Jack? Who will care for him - and his dog Henry - best?

title: The Carnival
author: Roderick Hunt
description: The children are on a float at the carnival. But when the car breaks down, they save the day and push their trailer all the way. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 3.

title: Carnival
author: Julie Sykes
description: Clare learns to sail with her kind old neighbour, Max, but when Max falls terribly ill, her world falls apart. All that is left is the present that he had left for her on the boat. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 16.TreeTops.

title: Carrie's War
author: Nina Bawden
description: Bombs were falling on London, and Carrie and Nick were wartime evacuees billeted in Wales on old Mr Evans. They were happy to visit their friend Albert at Druid's Bottom until Carrie did the worst thing she ever did in her life.

title: The Case of the Drowned Pearl
author: Robin Stevens
description: On holiday at the seaside, Daisy and Hazel discover the body of famous swimmer Antonia Braithwaite, nicknamed "the Pearl", on the beach. It appears she accidentally drowned, but the body mysteriously smells of soap.

title: The Case of the Fiendish Dancing Footprints
author: Karen Wallace
description: Sherlock Hound and his assistant, Dr WhatsUp Wombat, have their work cut out trying to find the baddy, Professor Greymatter, before he unleashes his latest nasty plan.

title: The Case of the Missing Mum
author: Steve Brezenoff
description: A shipment of dinosaur bones meant for a new exhibit at the Capitol City Natural History Museum has disappeared, and so have the five paleontologists who were working late at the museum, including Wilson Kipper's mother.

title: The Case of the Missing Treasure
author: Robin Stevens
description: A daring thief is robbing London's most famous museum - and Daisy and Hazel have worked out where they'll strike next! The girls must crack codes and unravel clues to solve the mystery with help from their friends, the Pinkertons. Book #2

title: The Case of the Smiling Shark
author: Tessa Krailing
description: The gang are helping Mrs Gale to clear the pond when they find a shark - and it's smiling! Oxford Reading Tree Stage 13. Treetops.

title: Castle Adventure
author: Roderick Hunt
description: Gran goes on an adventure. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 5 Stories.

title: Castle in the Air
author: Diana Wynne Jones
description: After buying a magic carpet, Abdullah finds his life changes dramatically as his daydreams begin to come true and dangerous adventures become his daily fare. Sequel to Howl's Moving Castle.

title: The Castle of Tangled Magic
author: Sophie Anderson
description: Olia finds a way from her family's castle into a magical land controlled by a wizard. The spirits of the magical world hope Olia will be able to save their land and, at the same time, save her family's home.

title: The Cat in the Coat
author: Vivian French
description: The cat takes the goat for a ride in his boat. The boat sinks and the cat ends up with the hat that he has coveted.

title: The Cat in the Hat
author: Dr. Seuss
description: Two children sitting at home on a rainy day are visited by the Cat in the Hat who shows them some tricks and games.

title: The Cat in the Hat Comes Back
author: Dr. Seuss
description: Two children are left with chores to do and get unexpected help from the Cat in the Hat.

title: A Cat in the Tree
author: Roderick Hunt
description: Wilma and her dad try to get a cat out of a tree and get stuck themselves. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 3. Book Band 4 (Blue).

title: The Cat Who Wanted to Go Home
author: Jill Tomlinson
description: Suzy, the little striped cat, climbs into the basket of a hot air balloon and is carried over the Channel from her home in France to England. It won't be easy to get back but Suzy refuses to be put off by a bit of water.

title: Cat's Painting
author: Jan Burchett
description: Nok helps Cat with a painting.Book Band 4 Light Blue A. Oxford Level 4.

title: Cat's Picnic
author: Alison Hawes
description: Cat and Nok have a picnic.Book Band 2. Red B. Oxford Level 2.

title: Catch It, Tizz!
author: Paul Shipton
description: High/low series for struggling readers aged 7 to 9+ years.Level 1 Elephant Tracks.Reading Age: 5.09Interest Age: 7+

title: Catching Flies
author: June Crebbin
description: Illustrated by Anne Shuttlewood. Gold Band 9

title: Catching the Moon
author: Mal Peet
description: Hal wants the moon, so his parents send their servants to get it for him.The co-author is Elspeth Graham. Illustrated by Xiao Xin. Blue Band 4.

title: Cats
author: Gemma Barder
description: Do you know your Siamese from your Shorthair? Are you crazy for cats? Whether you own a cat or simply love them, this book will tell you all you could possibly need to know about caring for one.

title: The Cauldron of Darkness
author: Roderick Hunt
description: The Virans strike closer to the Time Runners than ever before in this adventure set at the time of the slave trade in the Caribbean. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 13. TreeTops Time Chronicles. Book Band 13 (Grey). Book #6

title: The Cave of Life
author: Steve Cole
description: The micro-friends meet Kree-Ator, the living soul of Planet Kree-Mar, who needs their help to keep her planet alive. Book Band 10 White. Oxford Level 10.

title: Cave of Secrets
author: Vicki Low
description: While on a caving expedition in France, young Natasha stumbles on a secret that teachers her about the past -- and about herself.

title: Celebrating Black History
author: Errol Lloyd
description: This book tells the story of Africans and descendants of Africans as they suffer and strive to overcome slavery, oppression and discrimination in western society. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 12A Non-Fiction. TreeTops.

title: The Celery Stalks at Midnight
author: James Howe
description: Chester the cat is more than ever convinced that Bunnicula is a vampire when there is a harvest of white vegetables. Especially as it was on the morning after the night that Bunnicula was probably wandering through the neighbourhood.

title: The Celts
author: Leonie Pratt
description: Who were the Celts exactly? Did you know they lived on top of hills? And do you know how they made themselves look scary in battle? Discover all the answers and lots more in this fascinating book about the Celts.

title: The Celts
author: Sean Gallery
description: Travel back in time 2000 years to when the Iron Age Celtic tribes migrated to Britain. Find out what Britain was like before they arrived, how they set up their communities and what life was like for them.

title: The Chalice of the Gods
author: Rick Riordan
description: After saving the world multiple times, Percy Jackson is hoping to have a normal senior year. Unfortunately, the gods aren't quite done with him. Text contains mild violence. Book #6

title: The Championship Cheats
author: Chris Hoy
description: The Districts are making the Hercules' Hopefuls nervous. But it's not just that on Fergus's mind: Mum has been acting oddly, and rival coach Choppy Wallace turns up with an offer that's too good to be true. Co-author is Joanna Nadin. Book #4

title: The Changeover
author: Margaret Mahy
description: Laura must make a "Changeover" into witch-hood to rescue her brother from a mysterious illness.

title: Changing Designs
author: Catherine Veitch
description: From TVs and fridges to phones and music players, the design of many things we use every day has changed over time. White Band 10.

title: Changing Shape
author: Greg Pyers
description: This book explains how animals change shape to protect themselves, attract other animals and move about.

title: Charge!
author: Haydn Middleton
description: Join Ant and Tiger as they find out about conflicts and warfare through the ages. Book band 12 (Brown). Theme: Conflicts.

title: Charles Darwin
author: Isabel Sánchez Vegara
description: Born into a family of scientists, Charles spent much of his childhood studying nature. His fascination with nature led him aboard the HMS Beagle, where he took a journey that would change scientific thinking forever.

title: Charles Dickens
author: Jim Eldridge
description: A biography of the writer Charles Dickens. Lime Band 11

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
author: Roald Dahl
description: Each of five children lucky enough to discover an entry ticket into Mr Willy Wonka's mysterious chocolate factory takes advantage of the situation in their own way.

title: Charlie and the Great Glass Elevator
author: Roald Dahl
description: Fantastic journey as Charlie Bucket travels through space in the glass elevator.

title: Charlie Cook's Favourite Book
author: Julia Donaldson
description: This circular tale, in which each new book character is reading about the next, begins and ends with Charlie Cook.

title: Charlie the Bridesmaid
author: Narinder Dhami
description: When Charlie's mum wants her to wear a frilly dress for her aunt's wedding, Charlie decides to give the dress away. How will she manage to get it back?

title: Charlotte's Web
author: E.B. White
description: In this endearing story, a little girl and Charlotte, a beautiful grey spider, struggle to save Wilbur the pig from being butchered.

title: Charm Hall: Midnight Mayhem
author: Tabitha Black
description: Charm Hall is putting on a production of A Midsummer Night's Dream, but can the girls, Paige, Summer and Shannon, find out who is trying to sabotage it?

title: The Chase
author: Roderick Hunt
description: Floppy chases a cat. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 2. Book Band 3 (Yellow).

title: The Chatterbox Turtle
author: Cynthia Rider
description: The Chatterbox Turtle tries to stop talking. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 5. Snapdragons.

title: Chemical Chaos
author: Nick Arnold
description: Find out why glass eyes aren't really made of glass, what would make the worst stink bomb ever, and how to make your own toothpaste. If you think you can stomach the sick side of science read on. Science can be horrible.

title: The Chicken Knitters
author: Cath Jones
description: Lilly rescues some chickens who are cold and helps them learn to knit and start a new life away from Farmer Claw.

title: Chicken Licken
author: Jeremy Strong
description: When an acorn falls on Chicken Licken's head, he thinks the sky is falling down. Illustrated by Tony Blundell. Purple Band 8

title: The Child's Elephant
author: Rachel Campbell-Johnston
description: Bat adopts a baby elephant after witnessing her mother's death. The bond they form lasts a lifetime, even when Bat's world is turned upside down.

title: Chimp with a Limp
author: Lesley Sims
description: When Cheetah asks Chimp for help, Chimps makes up a story about being unable to because he has a limp.Co-author is David Semple.

title: China's Terracotta Army
author: Juliet Kerrigan
description: When the First Emperor of China died 2000 years ago, he was buried in a giant tomb. In 1974, this tomb was discovered along with an army of over 6000 terracotta warriors. Gold Band 9

title: Chinese Adventure
author: Roderick Hunt
description: Floppy breaks Gran's Chinese vase. Can the magic help to mend it? Oxford Reading Tree Stage 7 More Stories A.

title: Chloe Kelly
author: Harry Meredith
description: Learn about the life of Chloe Kelly, who scored the winning goal at Euro 2022.

title: Chloe the Chameleon
author: Celia Warren
description: Chloe tries to catch a fly with a flick and a lick, but the fly is too quick. What can Chloe do?

title: The Chocolate Cake
author: Dawn McMillan
description: Nathan and Tess make a chocolate cake on a cold, wet day.

title: Chocolate: From Bean to Bar
author: Anita Ganeri
description: Learn all about the chocolate-making process. Copper Band 12.

title: Chooky
author: Elizabeth Russell-Arnot
description: A mother hen tries to protect her chicks from the rat and the cat on the farm.

title: Christmas Adventure
author: Roderick Hunt
description: A little story of family cooperation and celebration of the Christmas holiday. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 6 More Stories A.

title: A Christmas Carol
author: Penny Dolan
description: Scrooge was not a kind man. One Christmas Eve he was visited by three ghosts, who took him on a journey from the past, through the present and in to the future. Illustrated by Karen Donnelly. White Band 10

title: A Christmas Carol (Unabridged)
author: Charles Dickens
description: In this classic story, Ebenezer Scrooge learns the true meaning of Christmas after being visited by three ghosts.

title: Christmas Chaos for the Hundred-Mile-An-Hour Dog
author: Jeremy Strong
description: Christmas is coming - and Streaker's pups have gone missing! But who took them, and where are they? Trevor and Tina get right on the case with the 'help' of their two trusty dogs. Chaos is only too likely to ensue.

title: The Christmas Day Kitten
author: James Herriot
description: An irresistible kitten finds a new home on Christmas morning.

title: A Christmasaurus Carol
author: Tom Fletcher
description: Ebenezer Scrooge steps out of his story and into this one. He plans to cancel Christmas. But William and the Christmasaurus are on the case, and determined to track down Scrooge and save Christmas. Book #5

title: Cinderella
author: Julia Jarman
description: Cinderella wants to go to the ball at the palace, but she must stay in the kitchen working. What can she do? Book Oxford Reading Tree Stage 7. Traditional Tales. Book Band 7 (Turquoise).

title: The Cinderella Play
author: Julia Donaldson
description: The twins perform in a school play. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 5. Songbirds Phonics.

title: Clare and the Fair
author: Julia Donaldson
description: One poem and one story about Clare's day out at the fair. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 6. Songbirds Phonics.

title: Clarice Bean, That's Me
author: Lauren Child
description: The wickedly fabulous Clarice Bean searches for just a little peace and quiet amidst an annoying family.

title: Class Six and the Very Big Rabbit
author: Martin Waddell
description: It's just a normal lesson on a normal day, except Mrs Bennet , who can do magic, has turned into a very big rabbit. The problems start when the class realise that Mrs Bennet can't change back into herself. Illustrated by Tony Ross. White Band 10

title: Claude All at Sea
author: Alex T. Smith
description: When Claude leaves the taps running, a quiet bath time turns into a rollicking seafaring adventure!

title: Claude: Best in Show
author: Alex T. Smith
description: The Great Waggy Avenue Dog Show is happening today - and there are medals galore to be won! If only they knew a dog so Claude and Sir Bobblysock could take part.

title: Claude: Lights! Camera! Action!
author: Alex T. Smith
description: A playful jump on a trampoline turns out to be more than Claude expected when he bounces right into an all-action gorilla thriller!

title: Claw the Giant Monkey
author: Adam Blade
description: Tom continues his journey by entering a dangerous jungle where he confronts a terrible creature which was created by a powerful wizard. Book #8

title: Claws
author: Jan Burchett
description: Cat and Ant find a big crab, which soon gets bigger than them!Book Band 5 Green A. Oxford Level 5.

title: Clay Creatures
author: Laura Vogelnest
description: This book gives directions on how to make different types of clay creatures.

title: Clean Up!
author: Nathan Bryon
description: Rocket can't wait to visit her grandparents on their beautiful island, but she soon sees that plastic pollution is spoiling the beaches and endangering the wild life. Can Rocket find a way to clean up the island? Illustrated by Dapo Adeola.

title: Cleaner Genie
author: Alan MacDonald
description: Bradley is the messiest boy in the world. He can't believe his luck when he has the chance to make the biggest mess he wants, but he soon wishes he'd been more careful with his wish. Oxford Reading Tree All Stars.

title: Cleared for Take-off!
author: Chris Oxlade
description: This book looks at human flight from the earliest planes to the super-modern airliners. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 10 Non-Fiction. TreeTops.

title: Clem and Crab
author: Fiona Lumbers
description: Clem is an explorer and a protector of the seas! Treasure hunting on her beloved beach, she stumbles across Crab, whose claw is stuck in a plastic bag. Crab will be much safer and happier in the city with Clem, but doesn't he belong on the beach?

title: Clementine's Smile
author: Lynne Rickards
description: A rhyming story about a crocodile with a sore tooth going to visit the dentist. Illustrated by Simona Meisser. Orange Band 6

title: Clever Chick
author: Paul Shipton
description: Clever chick cleverly gets the better of a fox.

title: Clever Fox
author: Beverley Randell
description: Fox must try to escape from a dog that is chasing him.

title: Cliffhanger
author: Jacqueline Wilson
description: From climbing and abseiling to canoeing, the adventure holiday promises to be full of action. There's just one problem as far as Tim is concerned: he is hopeless at sports of any kind. Can Tim survive the horrors of a week packed with activity?

title: Climbing
author: Jill Atkins
description: Learn all about climbing different things.

title: Clive Keeps His Cool
author: Michaela Morgan
description: Clive is on a class trip. Things start badly and they get worse... until Clive comes up with an idea to keep everyone cool. Oxford Reading Tree Stage 12. TreeTops.

title: Clockwork or All Wound Up
author: Philip Pullman
description: A mechanical prince, a sinister doctor, a deadly knight in armour, and a tormented apprentice clock-maker are the main characters of this story.

title: Cloud Boy
author: Marcia Williams
description: Harry and Angie are best friends who love tree-houses, sweets and cloud-watching. When Harry becomes ill, he needs Angie's help to cope with his situation. Grandma Gertie shares her story of bravery to help the children find the courage they need.

title: Cloud Busting
author: Malorie Blackman
description: Set in verse, this book tells the story of how Sam, a bully, develops a relationship with the boy who dares to be different. Their friendship blossoms and dies, but leaves its mark on Sam.

title: Cloud Forest
author: Nic Bishop
description: Lime Band 11

title: The Coat
author: Sharon Holt
description: High/low series for 7-14 year olds with a reading age of 5.5 to 9. Level 20 (Purple) -- reading age 7 to 7.5.

title: Coco's Bell
author: Andrew Kelly
description: The cat Coco gets a bell to help keep the birds safe.

title: Cocoa Warriors
author: Aleksandar Panev
description: A young Tabascan boy names Vakaki resents growing cocoa for his Aztec overlords. When Cortés, the Spanish conqueror arrives, Vakaki sees a way to defeat his masters.

title: Cogheart
author: Peter Bunzl
description: After her father's airship crashes and he disappears, Lily is put in great danger as she and her friends - the clockmaker's son and her mechanical fox - set out to find him in Victorian London. Book #1

title: A Collection of Rudyard Kipling's Just So Stories
author: Rudyard Kipling
description: This volume presents eight illustrated selections from Rudyard Kipling's Just so Stories, which provide fanciful explanations for such mysteries as how the camel got his hump, how the rhinoceros got his skin, and the origin of armadillos.

title: Colly's Barn
author: Michael Morpurgo
description: Annie's father is talking about tearing down the old barn. But what will happen to all the birds that nest there? Annie and her grandfather are worried. Then something amazing happens which shows the birds are wiser than they thought.

title: The Colossus of Rhodes
author: Caroline Lawrence
description: In 80 AD, ten-year-old Roman sleuth Flavia and her friends sail from Corinth to Rhodes to try to stop a mysterious man who is kidnapping children and selling them into slavery.

title: The Colour of Home
author: Mary Hoffman
description: Hassan, newly arrived in the United States and feeling homesick, paints a picture at school that shows his old home in Somalia as well as the reason his family had to leave.

title: Come Back Gizmo
author: Paul Jennings
description: Jimmy discovers to his cost that the gizmo has a way with animals too.
